page.title: 01GLYNARTHEN & BEULAH, DYFED
page.content: An area of well-spread farms and small centres of population.{Beulah}has a Post Office, general shop, garage, chapel & school.{Glynarthen}has a Post Office, chapel and school.{Farming}is a mixture of sheep with a little dairy and arable.{Tourism}is an important source of employment both on caravan sites, and on farms with holiday cottages or providing bed & breakfast. A large{equestrian centre}attracts visitors. A small{nursery}& garden centre is visited by local people and visitors in the area and travelling on the nearby A 487 road.{Employment, food and general shopping are available in{Newcastle Emlyn}to the south, and{Cardigan and Aberaeron.}The area has the general name of{ {Bettws Evan. {}
